name: NETXP LINUX Suspicious Commands used in /sbin and /usr/sbin
description: Monitors suspicious commands in /sbin and /usr/sbin, which may indicate potential security risks. This rule covers commands related to network configuration, firewall management, and other system-level activities. Detection of such commands could signal potential unauthorized changes to critical system components.
author: Szymon Gluch
query:
//any where auditd.log.key: "sbin_susp" and 
any where event.module: "auditd"
